title: Wet weather causes cycling chaos at World Championships in Yorkshire – video
text:
Heavy rain caused treacherous cycling conditions in Yorkshire, with two competitors during the third day of the UCI Road World Championships crashed in the wet weather.



In the men's under-23 time trial, Hungarian Attila Valter took a spectacular slide after coming off his bike going through surface water, while Denmark's Johan Price-Pejtersen found himself submerged in a giant puddle that covered most of the Yorkshire road.

Both riders were able to continue, although Price-Pejtersen finished last
description: One cycler found himself submerged in a giant puddle that covered most of the road
